title: How to Remove Copper Stains from Baths and Showers

steps.title: Make up a paste.
steps.content: Make up a paste. Use equal quantities of cream of tartar and baking soda (bicarbonate of soda). [1] X Research source Add a little water to mix into a smooth paste. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Spread the paste across the blue-green stain.
steps.content: Spread the paste across the blue-green stain . Rub in well. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Leave the paste to work on the stain.
steps.content: Leave the paste to work on the stain. About half an hour should be sufficient time for it to do its cleaning job. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Rinse off the paste.
steps.content: Rinse off the paste. Check the stain to see how much has been removed. Repeat if needed. [5] X Research source
